intro: Prinos dubius, commonly known as the Cape rose. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is often grown as an ornamental due to its striking appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal water once established. Prinos dubius is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
